children.text:
subroutine quicksort(arr, low, high, values)
    integer, dimension(:), intent(inout) :: arr
    integer, intent(in) :: low, high
    integer, dimension(:), intent(in) :: values
    integer :: pivot, i, j, temp if (low < high) then
        pivot = arr(high) i = low -1 do j = low, high-1
            if (values(arr(j)+1) <= values(pivot+1)) then
                i = i +1
                temp = arr(i)
                arr(i) = arr(j)
                arr(j) = temp
            end if
        end do
        temp = arr(i+1)
        arr(i+1) = arr(high)
        arr(high) = temp
        call quicksort(arr, low, i, values)
        call quicksort(arr, i+2, high, values)
    end if
end subroutine quicksort

        if (mod(bin,2) /= mod(current_idx,2)) then

Here's a possible implementation:

First, define a recursive subroutine to perform quicksort on the indices array between indices low and high.

subroutine quicksort(arr, low, high, values)
    integer, dimension(:), intent(inout) :: arr
    integer, intent(in) :: low, high
    integer, dimension(:), intent(in) :: values
    integer :: pivot, i, j, temp
    if (low < high) then
        pivot = arr(high)
        i = low -1
        do j = low, high-1
            if (values(arr(j)+1) <= values(pivot+1)) then
                i = i +1
                temp = arr(i)
                arr(i) = arr(j)
                arr(j) = temp
            end if
        end do
        temp = arr(i+1)
        arr(i+1) = arr(high)
        arr(high) = temp
        call quicksort(arr, low, i, values)
        call quicksort(arr, i+2, high, values)
    end if
end subroutine quicksort

program main
    implicit none
    integer :: N, i, ans1, answer, sqrt_n, count, j, n
    integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: values, indices

    ! Read input for first part
    read(*,*) N
    allocate(values(1:N))
    read(*,*) (values(i), i=1,N)
    allocate(indices(1:N))
    indices = [(i-1, i=1,N)]

    ! Sort indices using quicksort based on values(indices+1)
    call quicksort(indices, 1, N, values)

    ! Process the sorted indices to compute diff and ans1
    integer :: bin =0, diff =0
    do i =1, N
        integer :: current_idx = indices(i)
        if (mod(bin,2) /= mod(current_idx,2)) then
            diff = diff +1
        end if
        bin = mod(bin +1,2)
    end do
    ans1 = diff /2

    ! Process the second part using ans1 as input
    n = ans1
    answer =0
    sqrt_n = int(sqrt(real(n)))
    do i=2, sqrt_n
        count =0
        do while (mod(n,i) ==0)
            n = n/i
            count = count +1
        end do
        j=1
        do while (count -j >=0)
            count = count -j
            answer = answer +1
            j = j+1
        end do
    end do
    if (n >1) then
        answer = answer +1
    end if

    write(*,*) answer

contains
    recursive subroutine quicksort(arr, low, high, values)
        integer, dimension(:), intent(inout) :: arr
        integer, intent(in) :: low, high
        integer, dimension(:), intent(in) :: values
        integer :: pivot, i, j, temp
        if (low < high) then
            pivot = arr(high)
            i = low -1
            do j = low, high-1
                if (values(arr(j)+1) <= values(pivot+1)) then
                    i = i +1
                    temp = arr(i)
                    arr(i) = arr(j)
                    arr(j) = temp
                end if
            end do
            temp = arr(i+1)
            arr(i+1) = arr(high)
            arr(high) = temp
            call quicksort(arr, low, i, values)
            call quicksort(arr, i+2, high, values)
        end if
    end subroutine quicksort
end program main
